label: Sustainability in Fiction
description: Grand Challenge Learning course in the Sustainability, Energy & the Environment Pathway. Exploration of how narrative fiction focused on sustainability -- such as "cli-fi" (dystopian fiction about climate change) -- shapes our relation to the natural world. Includes experiential learning projects. Topics vary by section. Prerequisite: Restricted to first-year freshmen and transfer students.
courseSectionInformation: Prerequisite: Restricted to first-year freshmen and transfer students.
sectionDegreeAttributes: Grand Challenge-Sustainability, and Literature and the Arts course.
sectionCappArea: Restricted to First Time Freshman or Transfer student - first time students.
